title: DUP deals Brexit hammer blow to Boris Johnson ahead of crucial EU summit
text:
Boris Johnson needs the support of his confidence and supply partners to pass a deal in parliament | Isabel Infantes/AFP via Getty Images DUP deals Brexit hammer blow to Boris Johnson ahead of crucial EU summit ‘As things stand, we could not support what is being suggested,’ Northern Ireland party says.

LONDON — Boris Johnson suffered a major blow ahead of a crucial European Council summit when the DUP announced Thursday morning it was still not happy with his Brexit plan.

Party leader Arlene Foster and deputy leader Nigel Dodds issued a joint statement saying three key issues were holding up a breakthrough.

“As things stand, we could not support what is being suggested on customs and consent issues and there is a lack of clarity on VAT,” the pair said.

“We will continue to work with the government to try and get a sensible deal that works for Northern Ireland and protects the economic and constitutional integrity of the United Kingdom.”

The U.K. prime minister needs the support of the DUP, his confidence and supply partners, to have any chance of getting a Brexit deal through parliament.

He is due to arrive Thursday afternoon at the European Council summit in Brussels, where he hopes to get an agreement on a Brexit deal signed off by fellow EU leaders.
